newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - May 8.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - May 8.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and Local Government Minister Zillur Rahman have been unanimously re-elected the President and General Secretary of the ruling Awami League.
Different government departments are being encouraged to use environment-friendly Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) in their vehicles, Department of Environment (DOE) officials said.
No constitutional ammendment will be required for separation of the judiciary from the administration, the High Court pronounced in a judgement on Wednesday.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina leaves Dhaka for the Maldives on May 11 to the three-day ninth summit of the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC).

Main opposition in parliament Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) on Wednesday demanded immediate constitution of different parliamentary committees with proportional representation to make the parliament effective and accountable.
Customs officials in Zia International Airport on Wednesday recovered 1,180 toals of smuggled gold, and arrested an airport employees in connection of the smuggling.

Port users have announced a three-phase action programme beginning May 11 which will culminate into an indefinite boycott from May 20 to press their demand for allowing private container handling equipment in Chittagong Port.

A group of some 30 British investors having stakes in Bangladesh's hitherto untapped but potential and recently unfolding energy sector will be on a two-day familiarisation visit to the country next week. REUTER
